qas.question: When was the convention of prime ministers initiating the dissolution of parliament started?
In Ireland, when was the power to dissolve parliament assigned to the prime minister?
The 1922 Irish Free State Constitution previously gave what body the power to dissolve parliament?
What was the Executive Council an alternate name for?
Who lost the power to request a dissolution of parliment in 1918?
since when has the power to request a dissalution belonged to the whole government?
What does the Executive Council have the power to do in Ireland?
What could the Taoiseach due prior to 1922

context: Older constitutions often vest this power in the <a3_0>cabinet<a3_0/>. In the United Kingdom, for example, the tradition whereby it is the <b4_0>prime minister<b4_0/> who <b6_0><b7_0>requests a dissolution of parliament<b7_0/><b6_0/> dates back to <a0_0><b5_0>1918<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Prior to then, it was the entire government that made the request. Similarly, though the modern <a1_0>1937<a1_0/> Irish constitution grants to the Taoiseach the right to make the request, the earlier 1922 Irish Free State Constitution vested the power in <a2_0>the Executive Council<a2_0/> (the then name for the Irish cabinet).
